member.name: T:FX3Api.My.Resources.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:FX3Api.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:FX3Api.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:FX3Api.My.Resources.Resources.BuildDate
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Thu 06/27/2019 13:24:43.01 .

member.name: P:FX3Api.My.Resources.Resources.CurrentBranch
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to generic_stream .

member.name: P:FX3Api.My.Resources.Resources.CurrentCommit
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to eee943f2cf38653a06efbb679c7477744f99a6ed .

member.name: P:FX3Api.My.Resources.Resources.CurrentURL
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to https://github.com/juchong/iSensor-FX3-Interface.git .

member.name: T:FX3Api.FX3Connection
member.summary: This is the primary class for interfacing with the FX3 based eval platform. Implements IRegInterface, ISpi32Interface, and IPinFcns, in addition to a superset of extra interfacing functions specific to the FX3 platform.

member.name: E:FX3Api.FX3Connection.UnexpectedDisconnect
member.summary: This event is raised when the active board is disconnected unexpectedly (IE unplugged)
member.param: Serial number of the board which was disconnected

member.name: E:FX3Api.FX3Connection.DisconnectFinished
member.summary: This event is raised when the disconnect event for a board has finished, and it is reprogrammed with the ADI bootloader. This event only is triggered for boards which were explicitly disconnected (boards which were physically reset will not trigger this event).
member.param: Serial number of the board
Time (in ms) elapsed between the disconnect call and board re-enumeration

member.name: E:FX3Api.FX3Connection.NewBufferAvailable
member.summary: This event is raised when there is a new buffer available from a buffered stream

member.name: E:FX3Api.FX3Connection.StreamFinished
member.summary: This event is raised when a stream is finished

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,FX3Api.DeviceType)
member.summary: Class Constructor. Loads SPI settings and default values for the interface, and starts a background thread to manage programming newly connected boards with the ADI bootloader.
member.param: The path to the FX3 application firmware image file.
The path to the ADI FX3 bootloader image file.
The path to the flash programmer application image file.
The sensor type. Valid inputs are IMU and ADcmXL. Default is IMU.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.SetDefaultValues(FX3Api.DeviceType)
member.summary: Sets the default values for the interface. Used in constructor and after FX3 reset.
member.param: Parameter to specify default device SPI settings. Valid options are IMU and ADcmXL

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.SclkFrequency
member.summary: Property to get or set the FX3 SPI clock frequency setting. Reqcode: B2 Value: Don't Care Index: 0 Length: 4 Data: Clock Frequency to be set
member.returns: The current SPI clock frequency, in MHZ. Valid values are in the range 1 to 40,000,000

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.Cpol
member.summary: Property to get or set the FX3 SPI controller clock polarity setting (True - Idles High, False - Idles Low) Reqcode: B2 Value: Polarity (0 active low, 1 active high) 'Index: 1 Length: 4 Data: None
member.returns: The current polarity setting

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.Cpha
member.summary: Property to get or set the FX3 SPI controller chip select phase Reqcode: B2 Value: Polarity (0 active low, 1 active high) Index: 2 Length: 4 Data: None
member.returns: The current chip select phase setting

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ChipSelectPolarity
member.summary: Property to get or set the FX3 SPI chip select polarity (True - Active High, False - Active Low) Reqcode: B2 Value: Polarity (0 active low, 1 active high) Index: 3 Length: 4 Data: None
member.returns: The current chip select polarity

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ChipSelectControl
member.summary: Property to get or set the FX3 SPI controller chip select setting. Should be left on hardware control, changing modes will likely cause unexpected behavior. Reqcode: B2 Value: Desired setting (as SpiChipselectControl ) Index: 4 Length: 4 Data: None
member.returns: The current chip select control mode

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ChipSelectLeadTime
member.summary: The number of SPI clock cycles before the SPI transaction that chip select is toggled to active. Reqcode: B2 Value: Desired Setting (as SpiLagLeadTime ) Index: 5 Length: 4 Data: None
member.returns: The current chip select lead time setting

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ChipSelectLagTime
member.summary: The number of SPI clock cycles after the transaction ends that chip select is toggled to idle. Reqcode: B2 Value: Desired Setting (as SpiLagLeadTime ) Index: 6 Length: 4 Data: None
member.returns: The current chip select lag time setting

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.IsLSBFirst
member.summary: The FX3 SPI Controller LSB setting. The controller flips the bits depending on this setting. Reqcode: B2 Value: Polarity (0 MSB first, 1 LSB first) Index: 7 Length: 4 Data: None
member.returns: The current LSB First setting, as a boolean

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.WordLength
member.summary: The FX3 SPI controller word length. Default is 8 (1 byte per word) Reqcode: B2 Value: Word length (as int8) Index: 8 Length: 4 Data: None
member.returns: The current word length

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.StallTime
member.summary: Property to get/set the number of microseconds between words Reqcode: B2 Value: Stall time in microseconds (as int16) Index: 9 Length: 4 Data: None
member.returns: The current stall time, in microseconds

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.PartType
member.summary: The DUT type connected to the board. Reqcode: B2 Value: Part type to set Index: 10 Length: 4 Data: None
member.returns: Returns the DUTType. Defaults to 3 axis

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.DrPolarity
member.summary: The Data Ready polarity for streaming mode (index 11)
member.returns: The data ready polarity, as a boolean (True - low to high, False - high to low)

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ReadyPin
member.summary: Property to get or set the DUT data ready pin.
member.returns: The IPinObject of the pin currently configured as the data ready

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.TimerTickScaleFactor
member.summary: Read only property to get the timer tick scale factor used for converting ticks to ms.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.GetBoardSpiParameters
member.summary: Function to read the current SPI parameters from the FX3 board
member.returns: Returns a FX3SPIConfig struct representing the current board configuration

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.WriteBoardSpiParameters
member.summary: Function which writes the current SPI config to the FX3

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ConfigureSPI(System.Int32)
member.summary: Function which performs the SPI configuration option based on the current control endpoint setting
member.param: The SPI clock frequency, if it needs to be set

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.SetPinResistorSetting(AdisApi.IPinObject,FX3Api.FX3PinResistorSetting)
member.summary: Set the FX3 GPIO input stage pull up or pull down resistor setting. All FX3 GPIOs have a software configurable pull up / pull down resistor (10KOhm).
member.param: The pin to set (FX3PinObject)
The pin resistor setting to apply

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.WatchdogTimeoutSeconds
member.summary: Set the FX3 firmware watchdog timeout period (in seconds). If the watchdog is triggered the FX3 will reset.

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.WatchdogEnable
member.summary: Enable or disable the FX3 firmware watchdog.

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.DutSupplyMode
member.summary: Get or set the DUT supply mode on the FX3. Available options are regulated 3.3V, USB 5V, and off. This feature is only available on the ADI in-house iSensor FX3 eval platform, not the platform based on the Cypress Explorer kit. If a Cypress Explorer kit is connected, the setter for this property will be disabled.
member.returns: The DUT supply voltage setting

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.GetFirmwareBuildDate
member.summary: Get the firmware build date and time

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.SetBootTimeStamp
member.summary: Set the boot unix timestamp in the FX3 application firmware

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.GetBoardStatus(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Gets the current status code from the FX3.
member.param: Return by reference of the verbose mode of the FX3

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.GetFX3ApiInfo
member.summary: This property returns a class containing some useful information about the current FX3 Dll. Some of the information is available as a attribute of the DLL, while others (build date/time and git revision) are generated at compile time using a pre-build batch file script.

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.NumFramesPurged
member.summary: Read-only property to get the number of bad frames purged with a call to PurgeBadFrameData. Frames are purged when the CRC appended to the end of the frame does not match the expected CRC.
member.returns: Number of frames purged from data array

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.NumFramesSkipped
member.summary: Property to get the number of frame skips in an ADcmXL real time stream

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.SensorType
member.summary: Property to get the device family type the FX3 was initialized for. Setting this property restores all SPI settings to the default for the selected device family.
member.returns: The current device mode, as an FX3Interface.DeviceType

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.PinExit
member.summary: Gets and sets the pin exit configuration for exiting real-time stream mode.
member.returns: Pin exit configuration (0 = Pin Exit Disabled, 1 = Pin Exit Enabled)

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.PinStart
member.summary: Gets and sets the pin start configuration for starting real-time stream mode.
member.returns: Pin start configuration (0 = Pin Start Disabled, 1 = Pin Start Enabled

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.BufferAvailable
member.summary: Checks if a streaming frame is available, or will be available soon in thread safe queue. If there is no data in the queue and the streaming thread is not currently running, it will return false.
member.returns: The frame availability

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.GetBuffer
member.summary: Gets one frame from the thread safe queue. Waits to return until a frame is available if there is a stream running. If there is not a stream running, and there is no data in the queue this call returns "Nothing".
member.returns: The frame, as a byte array

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.GetNumBuffersRead
member.summary: Read-only property to get the number of buffers read in from the DUT in buffered streaming mode
member.returns: The current buffer read count

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.calcCCITT16(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Expects bytes in the order they are clocked out of ADcmXLx021 CRC-16-CCITT, initialized with CRC = 0xFFFF, No final XOR. Limit crc accumulation to 16 bits to prevent U32 overflow.
member.param: The input data set to calculate the CRC of
member.returns: The CRC value for the input array

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.calcCCITT16(System.UInt16[])
member.summary: Overload for CRC calculation which takes UShort array
member.param: The data to calculate CRC for
member.returns: The CRC value

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.CheckDUTCRC(System.UInt16[]@)
member.summary: Checks the CRC for a real time frame
member.param: The frame to check
member.returns: A boolean indicating if the accelerometer data CRC matches the frame CRC

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.BitBangSpiConfig
member.summary: Property to get or set the bit bang SPI configuration. Can select pins, timings, etc

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.BitBangSpi(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Byte[],System.UInt32)
member.summary: Perform a bit banged SPI transfer, using the config set in BitBangSpiConfig.
member.param: The total number of bits to clock in a single transfer. Can be any number greater than 0.
The number of separate SPI transfers to clock out
The MOSI data to clock out. Each SPI transfer must be byte aligned. Data is clocked out MSB first
The time to wait on the bulk endpoint for a return transfer (in ms)
member.returns: The data received over the selected MISO line

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.BitBangReadReg16(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Read a standard iSensors 16-bit register using a bitbang SPI connection
member.param: The address of the register to read
member.returns: The register value

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.BitBangWriteRegByte(System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Write a byte to an iSensor register using a bitbang SPI connection
member.param: The address of the register to write to
The data to write to the register

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.RestoreHardwareSpi
member.summary: Resets the hardware SPI pins to their default operating mode. Can be used to recover the SPI functionality after a bit-bang SPI transaction over the hardware SPI pins without having to reboot the FX3.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.SetBitBangSpiFreq(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Set the SCLK frequency for a bit banged SPI connection. Overloaded to allow for a UInt
member.param: The SPI frequency, in Hz
member.returns: A boolean indicating if the frequency could be set.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.SetBitBangStallTime(System.Double)
member.summary: Set the bit bang SPI stall time. Driven by a clock with resolution of 49.3ns
member.param: Stall time desired, in microseconds. Minimum of 0.7us
member.returns: A boolean indicating if value is good or not. Defaults to closest possible value

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.SetBitBangSpiFreq(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the SCLK frequency for a bit bang SPI connection.
member.param: The desired SPI frequency. Can go from 800KHz to approx 0.001Hz

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.CrcFirstIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the first burst data word used in CRC calculations.

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.CrcLastIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the last burst data word used in CRC calculations.

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.CrcResultIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the word that contains the CRC result.

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.WordCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of 16 bit words that are read during the burst. Does not include trigger, real transfer will be 2 bytes larger.

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.BurstByteCount
member.summary: Get or set the burst word length, in bytes. Is the total count of bytes transfered, including trigger

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.TriggerReg
member.summary: Gets or sets register that is used to trigger burst operation.

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.BurstMOSIData
member.summary: Data to transmit on the MOSI line during a burst read operation. Is overwriten if you set the trigger reg, since trigger reg is given priority.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ClearBurstMode
member.summary: Takes interface out of burst mode by setting BurstMode to zero.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.SetupBurstMode
member.summary: Puts interface into burst mode by setting burstMode to match word count.
member.exception: Thrown if word count has not been set.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.WaitForStreamCompletion
member.summary: Overload of WaitForStreamCompletion which blocks forever

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.WaitForStreamCompletion(System.Int32)
member.summary: Blocks until the streaming endpoint mutex can be acquired. Allows a user to synchronize external application the completion of a stream. Returns false if there is not a stream running, or if the timeout is reached without the stream mutex being acquired.
member.param: The time to wait trying to acquire the stream mutex
member.returns: If the stream wait was successful

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.EnqueueStreamData(System.UInt16[]@)
member.summary: Place data in the thread safe queue and raise a buffer available event

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.CancelStreamAsync
member.summary: Cancel a any running stream

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.CancelStreamImplementation(FX3Api.USBCommands)
member.summary: Cancel running stream
member.param: ReqCode for the type of stream to cancel

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.StartBurstStream(System.UInt32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Byte})
member.summary: Function to start a burst read using the BurstStreamManager
member.param: The number of buffers to read in the stream operation

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.StripBurstTriggerWord
member.summary: Property to choose if the readback from the 16 bit trigger word at the start of each burst is discarded or not

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.BurstStreamManager
member.summary: This function reads burst stream data from the DUT over the streaming endpoint. It is intended to operate in its own thread, and should not be called directly.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.StartGenericStream(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{AdisApi.AddrDataPair},System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Starts a generic data stream. This allows you to read/write a set of registers on the DUT, triggering off the data ready if needed. The data read is placed in the thread-safe queue and can be retrieved with a call to GetBuffer. Each "buffer" is the result of reading the addr list of registers numCaptures times. For example, if addr is set to [0, 2, 4] and numCaptures is set to 10, each buffer will contain the 30 register values. The total number of register reads performed is numCaptures * numBuffers
member.param: The list of registers to
The number of captures of the register list per data ready
The total number of capture sequences to perform

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.GenericStreamManager(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function pulls generic stream data from the FX3 over a bulk endpoint (DataIn). It is intended to run in its own thread, and should not be called by itself.
member.param: Number of bytes per generic stream buffer

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ValidateGenericStreamConfig
member.summary: Validate the SPI configuration for a generic stream

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.StartRealTimeStreaming(System.UInt32)
member.summary: This function starts real time streaming on the ADcmXLx021 (interface and FX3). Specifying pin exit is optional and must be 0 (disabled) or 1 (enabled)

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.StopRealTimeStreaming
member.summary: This function stops real time streaming on the ADcmXLx021 (interface and FX3)

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.RealTimeStreamManager
member.summary: This function pulls real time data from the DUT over the streaming endpoint. It is intended to operate in its own thread, and should not be called directly

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.PurgeBadFrameData
member.summary: This function checks the CRC of each frame stored in the Stream Data Queue, and purges the bad ones
member.returns: The success of the data purge operation

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ValidateRealTimeStreamConfig
member.summary: This function validates the current SPI settings to ensure that they are compatible with the machine health real time streaming mode. If the settings are not compatible, a FX3ConfigException is thrown.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.PulseDrive(AdisApi.IPinObject,System.UInt32,System.Double,System.UInt32)
member.summary: This function drives a pin to the specified level for a given time interval in ms
member.param: The FX3PinObject for the pin to drive
The level to drive the pin to. 1 - high, 0 - low
The time to drive the pin for, in ms. Minimum of 3us.
Not implemented

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.PulseWait(AdisApi.IPinObject,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: This function waits for a pin to reach a specified level
member.param: The pin to poll
The level to wait for. 1 - high, 0 - low
The delay from the start of the function call to when the pin polling starts
The timeout from when the pin polling starts to when the function returns, if the desired level is never reached
member.returns: The total time waited (including delay) in ms

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ReadPin(AdisApi.IPinObject)
member.summary: Reads the value of a GPIO pin on the FX3
member.param: The pin to read, as a FX3PinObject
member.returns: The pin value - 1 is high, 0 is low

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ReadPins(AdisApi.IPinObject[])
member.summary: Reads a list of FX3 GPIO pins. This function calls the overload which takes an IEnumerable
member.param: An array of FX3PinObjects to read
member.returns: The pin values, as a UInteger. The first pin is in bit 0, second is in bit 1, and so on

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ReadPins(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{AdisApi.IPinObject})
member.summary: Reads a list of FX3 GPIO pins
member.param: An enumerable list of FX3PinObjects to read (maximum of 32)
member.returns: The pin values, as a UInteger. The first pin is in bit 0, second is in bit 1, and so on

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.SetPin(AdisApi.IPinObject,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Sets the value of a FX3 GPIO pin. This value will persist until the pin is set to a different value, or read from
member.param: The FX3PinObject pin to read
The polarity to set the pin to, 1 - high, 0 - low

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.MeasurePinFreq(AdisApi.IPinObject,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Measures the frequency of an input signal to the selected pin.
member.param: The pin to measure. Must be an FX3 pin object
THe edge to measure from. 0 - falling edge, 1 - rising edge
The time to wait for the FX3 to return values before defaulting to infinity (in ms)
THe number of periods to sample for. Minimum value of 1
member.returns: The signal frequency, in Hz. Goes to infinity if no signal found.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ReadDRFreq(AdisApi.IPinObject,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Reads the measured DR value
member.param: The DR pin to measure
The edge to measure from. 1 - low to high, 0 - high to low
The timeout from when the pin measurement starts to when the function returns if the signal cannot be found
member.returns: The DR frequency in Hz

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.MeasurePinDelay(AdisApi.IPinObject,System.UInt32,AdisApi.IPinObject,System.UInt32)
member.summary: This function measures the time delay between toggling a trigger pin, and a state change on the busy pin. This can be used to measure the propagation delay between a sync edge and data ready being de-asserted.
member.param: The pin to toggle. When this pin is driven to the selected polarity the delay timer starts
The polarity to drive the trigger pin to. 1- high, 0 - low
The pin to measure.
Operation timeout period, in ms
member.returns: The delay time, in ms

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.MeasureBusyPulse(AdisApi.IPinObject,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,AdisApi.IPinObject,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: This function triggers a DUT action using a pulse drive, and then measures the following pulse width on a separate busy line. The pulse time on the busy pin is measured using a 10MHz timer with approx. 1us accuracy.
member.param: The pin to drive for the trigger condition (for example a sync pin)
The time, in ms, to drive the trigger pin for
The polarity to drive the trigger pin at (0 - low, 1 - high)
The pin to measure a busy pulse on
The polarity of the pulse being measured (0 will measure a low pulse, 1 will measure a high pulse)
The timeout, in ms, to wait before canceling, if the pulse is never detected
member.returns: The pulse width, in ms. Accurate to approx. 1us

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.MeasureBusyPulse(System.Byte[],AdisApi.IPinObject,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Overload of measure busy pulse which triggers the DUT event using a SPI write instead of a pin drive.
member.param: The data to transmit on the MOSI line, to trigger the operation being measured
The pin to measure a busy pulse on
The polarity of the pulse being measured (0 will measure a low pulse, 1 will measure a high pulse)
The timeout, in ms, to wait before canceling, if the pulse is never detected
member.returns: The pulse width, in ms. Accurate to approx. 1us

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.StartPWM(System.Double,System.Double,AdisApi.IPinObject)
member.summary: This function configures the selected pin to drive a pulse width modulated output.
member.param: The desired PWM frequency, in Hz. Valid values are in the range of 0.05Hz (0.05) - 10MHz (10000000.0)
The PWM duty cycle. Valid values are in the range 0.0 - 1.0. To achieve a "clock" signal set the duty cycle to 0.5
The pin to configure as a PWM signal.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.StopPWM(AdisApi.IPinObject)
member.summary: This function call disables the PWM output from the FX3 and returns the pin to a tri-stated mode.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.isPWMPin(AdisApi.IPinObject)
member.summary: This function checks to see if the selected pin has already been configured to act as a PWM output pin.
member.param: The pin to check. Must be an FX3PinObject pin
member.returns: True if the pin is configured as a PWM pin, false otherwise

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.GetPinPWMInfo(AdisApi.IPinObject)
member.summary: Allows the user to retrieve a set of information about the current pin PWM configuration.
member.param: The pin to pull from the PinPWMInfo List
member.returns: The PinPWMInfo corresponding to the selected pin. If the pin is not found all fields will be -1

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.IsFX3Pin(AdisApi.IPinObject)
member.summary: This function determines if the pin object being passed is an FX3 version of the IPinObject (as opposed to a blackfin pin for the SDP).
member.param: The pin to check
member.returns: True if Pin is an FX3 pin, false if not

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ResetPin
member.summary: Read-only property to get the reset pin
member.returns: The reset pin, as an IPinObject

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.DIO1
member.summary: Read-only property to get the DIO1 pin
member.returns: Returns the DIO1 pin, as an IPinObject

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.DIO2
member.summary: Read-only property to get the DIO2 pin
member.returns: Returns the DIO2 pin, as an IPinObject

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.DIO3
member.summary: Read-only property to get the DIO3 pin
member.returns: Returns the DIO3 pin, as an IPinObject

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.DIO4
member.summary: Read-only property to get the DIO4 pin
member.returns: Returns the DIO4 pin, as an IPinObject

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.FX3_GPIO1
member.summary: Read-only property to get the FX3_GPIO1 pin. This pin does not map to the standard iSensor breakout, and should be used for other general purpose interfacing.
member.returns: Returns the GPIO pin, as an IPinObject

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.FX3_GPIO2
member.summary: Read-only property to get the FX3_GPIO2 pin. This pin does not map to the standard iSensor breakout, and should be used for other general purpose interfacing.
member.returns: Returns the GPIO pin, as an IPinObject

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.FX3_GPIO3
member.summary: Read-only property to get the FX3_GPIO3 pin. This pin does not map to the standard iSensor breakout, and should be used for other general purpose interfacing.
member.returns: Returns the GPIO pin, as an IPinObject

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.FX3_GPIO4
member.summary: Read-only property to get the FX3_GPIO4 pin. This pin does not map to the standard iSensor breakout, and should be used for other general purpose interfacing. This pin shares a complex GPIO block with DIO1. If DIO1 is being used as a clock source, via the StartPWM function, then this pin cannot be used as a clock source.
member.returns: Returns the GPIO pin, as an IPinObject

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.DrActive
member.summary: If the data ready is used for register reads
member.returns: The current data ready usage setting

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.BurstMode
member.summary: Switches burstMode on and off. Set burstMode to the number of burst read registers.
member.returns: The number of burst read registers.

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.StreamTimeoutSeconds
member.summary: Sets the timeout for the Bulk Endpoint used in real time streaming modes.
member.returns: The timeout time, in seconds

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.StartStream(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.UInt32},System.UInt32)
member.summary: Starts a buffered stream for only a single buffer. This is equivalent to StartBufferedStream(addr, numCaptures, 1, CurrentTimeout, Nothing)
member.param: The address list to read from
The number of times to capture that address list

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.StartBufferedStream(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.UInt32},System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.ComponentModel.BackgroundWorker)
member.summary: Starts a buffered stream operation. The registers listed in addr are read numCaptures times per register buffer. This process is repeated numBuffers times.
member.param: List of register addresses to read
Number of times to read the register list per buffer.
Number of total register buffers to read.
Stream timeout, in seconds
Background worker to handle progress updates

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.StartBufferedStream(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{AdisApi.AddrDataPair},System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.ComponentModel.BackgroundWorker)
member.summary: Starts a buffered stream operation. This is usually called from the TextFileStreamManager. DUTType must be set before executing.
member.param: The list of register addresses to read from, when PartType is not ADcmXLx021
The number of reads to perform on each register listed in addr
The total number of buffers to read. One buffer is either a frame or a set of register reads
The bulk endpoint timeout time
A Background worker object which can be used by a GUI to track the current stream status and send cancellation requests

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.StopStream
member.summary: Stops the currently running data stream, if any.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.GetBufferedStreamDataPacket
member.summary: This function returns a single buffered stream packet. Needed for IBufferedStreamProducer
member.returns: The stream data packet, as a short

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.GetStreamDataPacketU16
member.summary: This function does the same thing as GetBufferedStreamDataPacket()
member.returns: The last buffer read from the DUT

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ReadRegByte(System.UInt32)
member.summary: This is the most general ReadRegByte. Other implementations are based on this.
member.param: The address to read
member.returns: Returns the value read in over SPI as a short

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ReadRegWord(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Reads a single 16 bit register on the DUT
member.param: The address of the register to read
member.returns: The 16 bit register value, as a UShort

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.WriteRegByte(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: This is the most general WriteRegByte, which the others are based on
member.param: The address to write to
The byte of data to write

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.WriteRegByte(AdisApi.AddrDataPair)
member.summary: This function writes a single register byte, given as an Address / Data pair
member.param: The AddrDataPair to be written

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.WriteRegWord(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: This function is not currently implemented. Calling it will throw a NotImplementedException.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ReadRegArrayStream(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{AdisApi.AddrDataPair},System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: This is the most generic array register function. All other array read/write functions call down to this one.
member.param: The list of register addresses and optional write data for each capture
The number of times to iterate through addrData per DUT data ready (if DrActive is set)
The total number of buffers to read, where one buffer is considered numCaptures iterations through addrData
member.returns: An array of 16 bit values read back from the DUT. The size will be addrData.Count() * numCaptures * numBuffers

member.summary: Overload of ReadRegArray which builds a new IEnumerable of addr and call the overload which takes an enumerable of addr
member.param: List of register address's to read
Number of captures to perform on the register list
member.returns: The register values, as a short array

member.summary: This function writes an enumerable list of data to the DUT as AddrDataPairs

member.summary: Overload of WriteRegByte which allows for multiple registers to be specified to write to, as an IEnumerable list of register addresses.

The data to write to each register in the address list.

member.summary: Reads an array of 16 bit register values.
member.param: The list of registers to read
member.returns: The register values, as a UShort array

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ReadRegArray(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{AdisApi.AddrDataPair},System.UInt32)
member.summary: ReadRegArray overload which includes register writes. Breaks the call into multiple calls of readRegByte and writeRegByte
member.param: The data to read/write
The number of times to perform the read/write operation
member.returns: The output data, as a UShort array

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.Connect(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to program the selected FX3 board with the application firmware. The FX3 board should be programmed with the ADI bootloader.
member.param: Serial number of the device being connected to.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.Disconnect
member.summary: This function sends a reset command to the specified FX3 board, or does nothing if no board is connected

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.Disconnect(System.String)
member.summary: Overload of Disconnect which lets you specify the FX3 serial number to disconnect. Returns a boolean indicating if the board was disconnected.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.GetFX3BoardType
member.summary: Get the FX3 board type from the connected firmware.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.WaitForBoard(System.Int32)
member.summary:
This function is used to wait for an FX3 to be programmed with the ADI bootloader. In general, the programming model would go as follows, to connect and program the first board attached:
Dim myFX3 as FX3Connection = New FX3Connection(firmwarepath, bootloaderpath, devicetype) If Not myFX3.WaitForBoard(10) Then Msgbox("No boards found") Exit Sub End If myFX3.Connect(myFX3.AvailableFX3s(0))
member.param: The timeout to wait for a board to connect, in seconds
member.returns: If there is a board available (false indicates timeout occurred)

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ActiveFX3
member.summary: Property which returns the active FX3 board. Returns nothing if there is not a board connected.
member.returns: Returns active FX3 board if enumeration has been completed. Returns nothing otherwise.

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ActiveFX3SerialNumber
member.summary: Property which returns the serial number of the active FX3 board.
member.returns: Returns the serial number of the active FX3 device.

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.AvailableFX3s
member.summary: Property which returns a list of the serial numbers of all FX3 boards running the ADI bootloader
member.returns: All detected FX3 boards.

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.BusyFX3s
member.summary: Property which returns a list of the serial numbers of all FX3 boards currently in use, running the application firmware.
member.returns: The list of board serial numbers

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Connection.GetTargetSerialNumber

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.InitBoardList

member.summary: Handles connect events generated by the Cypress USB library

member.summary: Handles disconnect events generated by the cypress USB library

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.CheckDisconnectEvent(CyUSB.USBEventArgs)
member.summary: This function checks the event arguments when a USB disconnect occurs. If the FX3 which was disconnected is marked as the active device, this function attempts to gracefully update the interface state to prevent application lockup from accessing a disconnected board.
member.param: The event to handle

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.CheckConnectEvent(CyUSB.USBEventArgs)
member.summary: This function parses connect events. If the board connecting is running the ADI bootloader, and has a serial number which matches that of the most recently disconnected FX3, a disconnect finished event is raised. This allows GUIs or applications up the stack to better manage their event flow (rather than blocking in a disconnect call).
member.param: The event to handle

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.RefreshDeviceList
member.summary: Refreshes the list of FX3 boards connected to the PC and indicates to bootloader programmer thread if any need to be programmed

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ProgramBootloaderThread
member.summary: This function runs in a separate thread from the main application. When a new, un-programmed board is connected to the system, the device identifier is placed in a queue, indicating to this thread that a new board needs to be programmed with the ADI bootloader.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.Transfer(System.UInt32)
member.summary: This function performs a single bi-directional 32 bit SPI transaction. If DrActive is set to false the transfer is performed asynchronously. If DrActive is set to true, the transfer should wait until a data ready condition (determined by DrPin and DrPolarity) is true.
member.param: The 32 bit data to be send to the slave on the MOSI line
member.returns: The 32 bit data sent to the master over the MISO line during the SPI transaction

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.TransferArray(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.UInt32})
member.summary: This function performs an array bi-directional SPI transfer. WriteData.Count() total SPI transfers are performed. If DrActive is set to true, the transfer should wait until a data ready condition (determined by DrPin and DrPolarity) is true, and then perform all SPI transfers. If DrActive is false it is performed asynchronously.
member.param: The data to be written to the slave on the MOSI line in each SPI transaction. The total number of transfers performed is determined by the size of WriteData.
member.returns: The data received from the slave device on the MISO line, as an array

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.TransferArray(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.UInt32},System.UInt32)
member.summary: This function performs an array bi-directional SPI transfer. This overload transfers all the data in WriteData numCaptures times. The total number of SPI words transfered is WriteData.Count() * numCaptures. If DrActive is set to true, the transfer should wait until a data ready condition (determined by DrPin and DrPolarity) is true, and then perform all SPI transfers. If DrActive is false it is performed asynchronously.
member.param: The data to be written to the slave on the MOSI line in each SPI transaction.
The number of transfers of the WriteData array performed.
member.returns: The data received from the slave device on the MISO line, as an array. The total size is WriteData.Count() * numCaptures

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.TransferArray(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.UInt32},System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary:
This function performs an array bi-directional SPI transfer. If DrActive is set to true, this overload transfers all the data in WriteData numCaptures times per data ready condition being met. It captures data from numBuffers data ready signals. If DrActive is set to false, all the transfers are performed asynchronously. The total number of SPI transfers is WriteData.Count()*numCaptures*numBuffers.
The following pseduo-code snippet would perform 400 total SPI transfers, across 100 data ready conditions.
MOSI = {0x1234, 0x5678} myISpi32.DrActive = True MISO = myISpi32.TransferArray(MOSI, 2, 100)
During the transfers, the SPI bus would look like the following:
MOSI: ---(0x1234)---(0x5678)---(0x1234)---(0x5678)-----------------(0x1234)---(0x5678)---(0x1234)---(0x5678)--...-----(0x1234)-----(0x5678)-----(0x1234)-----(0x5678)-- MISO:----MISO(0)----MISO(1)----MISO(2)----MISO(3)------------------MISO(4)----MISO(5)----MISO(6)----MISO(7)---...-----MISO(196)----MISO(197)----MISO(198)----MISO(199)- DR: ___|¯¯¯|_____________________________________________________|¯¯¯|______________________________________..._____|¯¯¯|____________________________________________
member.param: The data to be written to the slave over the MOSI line in each SPI transaction
The number of transfers of the WriteData array performed on each data ready (if enabled).
The total number of data ready's to capture.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ISpi32Interface_StartBufferedStream(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.UInt32},System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.ComponentModel.BackgroundWorker)
member.summary: This is similar to the most general streaming function used by the IRegInterface, and all other buffered streaming functions can be derived from it with a little glue logic. When a stream is started, a second thread should be started to pull buffers from the interfacing board asynchronously. Each buffer will consist of WriteData.count() * numCaptures 32-bit words, which are just the raw data read back from the DUT over the MISO line. The stream is expected to produce numBuffers total buffers.
member.param: The data to send over the MOSI line
The number of iterations of the WriteData array to perform in a single buffer
The total number of buffers to capture
The time to wait on the interfacing board before stopping the stream
A background worker used to notify the caller of progress made in the stream. You MUST check that this parameter has been initialized

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ISpi32StopStream
member.summary: ISpi32 StopStream implementation. Calls generic version.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Connection.ISpi32Interface_GetBufferedStreamDataPacket
member.summary: Gets a buffer from the TransferStreamData thread safe queue. Same implementation as GetBuffer.

member.summary: Overload of contains which checks if the list contains the given Pin
member.param: The pin to look for (As IPinObject)
member.returns: If the pin is contained in the list

member.name: M:FX3Api.PinList.Contains(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Overload of contains which checks if the list contains the given Pin
member.param: The pin to look for (As Integer)
member.returns: If the pin is contained in the list

member.name: T:FX3Api.FX3Board
member.summary: This class contains information about the connected FX3 board

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Board.BoardType
member.summary: The FX3 board type (iSensor FX3 board or Cypress eval FX3 board)

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Board.ToString
member.summary: Override of the ToString function

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Board.Uptime
member.summary: Read-only property to get the current board uptime
member.returns: The board uptime, in ms, as a long

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Board.BuildDateTime
member.summary: Gets the date and time the FX3 application firmware was compiled.
member.returns: The date time string

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Board.SerialNumber
member.summary: Read-only property to get the active FX3 serial number
member.returns: The board serial number, as a string

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Board.FirmwareVersion
member.summary: Read-only property to get the current application firmware version on the FX3
member.returns: The firmware version, as a string

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Board.FirmwareVersionNumber
member.summary: Read-only property to get the firmware version number

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Board.VerboseMode
member.summary: Read-only property to check if the firmware version was compiled with verbose mode enabled. When verbose mode is enabled, much more data will be logged to the UART output. This is useful for debugging, but causes significant performance loss for high throughput applications.

member.name: P:FX3Api.FX3Board.BootloaderVersion
member.summary: Get the FX3 bootloader version. This is a second stage bootloader which is stored on the I2C EEPROM
member.returns: The bootloader version, as a string

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Board.SetFirmwareVersion(System.String)
member.summary: Set the firmware version. Is friend so as to not be accessible to outside classes.
member.param: The firmware version to set, as a string

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Board.SetVerboseMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets if the firmware is currently running in verbose mode. Should NOT be used in verbose mode in normal operating conditions.
member.param: If the board is in verbose mode or not

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Board.SetBootloaderVersion(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the bootloader version
member.param: The current bootloader version

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Board.SetDateTime(System.String)
member.summary: Set the Date/time string after connecting

member.name: T:FX3Api.FX3ConfigurationException
member.summary: This exception is used when the FX3 is configured with an invalid setting. Typically, these exceptions will not cause the board or interface to enter an invalid state, since they are caught before the setting is applied.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3ConfigurationException.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new exception

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3ConfigurationException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new exception with a specified message
member.param: The message to pass with the exception

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3ConfigurationException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Create a new exception with a specified message and the previous exception from down the stack
member.param: The message to pass with the exception
The lower level exception to pass up

member.name: T:FX3Api.FX3CommunicationException
member.summary: This exception is used when there is a communication failure with the FX3 board during a data transfer.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3CommunicationException.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new exception

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3CommunicationException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new exception with a specified message
member.param: The message to pass with the exception

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3CommunicationException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Create a new exception with a specified message and the previous exception from down the stack
member.param: The message to pass with the exception
The lower level exception to pass up

member.name: T:FX3Api.FX3BadStatusException
member.summary: This exception is used when the status returned from the FX3 board is not success (0). This typically indicates some sort of failure in the FX3 application firmware, which may require a board reset. The status codes are defined in the Cypress FX3 SDK.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3BadStatusException.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new exception

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3BadStatusException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new exception with a specified message
member.param: The message to pass with the exception

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3BadStatusException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Create a new exception with a specified message and the previous exception from down the stack
member.param: The message to pass with the exception
The lower level exception to pass up

member.name: T:FX3Api.FX3ProgrammingException
member.summary: This exception is used when the FX3 board enumeration and programming process fails. This typically indicates a flash failure at the cypress driver level, or a timeout when re-enumerating a programmed board.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3ProgrammingException.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new exception

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3ProgrammingException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new exception with a specified message
member.param: The message to pass with the exception

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3ProgrammingException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Create a new exception with a specified message and the previous exception from down the stack
member.param: The message to pass with the exception
The lower level exception to pass up

member.name: T:FX3Api.FX3Exception
member.summary: This exception is used for general faults which do not fit with the other defined exception types. These exceptions are still generated within the FX3 interface, and are not system exceptions.

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Exception.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new exception

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Exception.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new exception with a specified message
member.param: The message to pass with the exception

member.name: M:FX3Api.FX3Exception.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Create a new exception with a specified message and the previous exception from down the stack
member.param: The message to pass with the exception
The lower level exception to pass up
